learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate comprehension and application of the scientific basis of dentistry to the practice of the specialist dental disciplines.
Apply knowledge of anatomical structures of the orofacial region to accurately recognize, diagnose and treat a range of conditions commonly managed within the specialist dental disciplines.

Demonstrate an understanding of the scientific principles underlying the selection and use of instruments, laboratory and clinical materials/medicaments for management of patients including their interactions, applications, and biological considerations.
Demonstrate competency in pre-clinical exercises in a range of specialist dental disciplines.
Develop interprofessional practice skills including team functioning and communication to ensure successful outcomes.

assessments.due_date:
28/08/2025 4:00 pm

The exam will be held in-person in the scheduled preclinic activity in week 5.
assessments.task_description: The exam may contain a mixture of multiple-choice questions (MCQ), problem solving such as match the following, fill in the blanks, drag and drop labels, and/or short answer questions (SAQ). The exam will cover content from learning activities taught in the periodontics discipline inclusive of lectures, preclinic, peer clinics and research articles. No calculator permitted. Closed book.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The Observed Structured Clinical Examination is conducted in the preclinic session where students will work through stations and be asked to answer questions related to removable prosthodontics tasks that you have been taught in the preclinic through the semester. 

Tasks can include but not limited to: identifying anatomical landmarks and significance in edentulous casts. adapting light cure acrylic and making a special tray, identifying errors in denture teeth set up, identifying equipment and demonstrating their use, etc.

Marks are awarded for successfully performing composite tasks at each station.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: The end-of-semester exam will be held in-person via Inspera in the scheduled end of semester examination block. The exam will be for 60 mins duration. Please arrive 15 mins early to allow for ID check and set up in Inspera. Students will need a laptop for this exam with Inspera safe browser installed. If you do not have a laptop with access to the internet (connect to Eduroam) - you may be able to borrow a laptop from the library (web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/servicesstudents/ covid-19). The exam may contain a mixture of multiple choice questions (MCQ), problem solving such as match the following, fill in the blanks, drag and drop labels, and/or short answer (SAQ) and essay questions. It will cover content from learning activities in weeks 1-13 inclusive.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
